definitions.definition: to spoil or destroy something completely:
examples: Huge modern hotels have ruined this once unspoilt coastline.

definitions.definition: to cause a person or company to lose all their money or their good reputation:
examples: Cheap imported goods are ruining many businesses.

definitions.definition: the process or state of being spoiled or destroyed:
examples: The car accident meant the ruin of all her hopes.

definitions.definition: a situation in which a person or company has lost all their money or their reputation:
examples: Many companies are on the edge/brink/verge of ruin.

definitions.definition: the broken parts that are left from an old building or town:
(of a building or city) to be extremely badly damaged so that most of it has fallen down:
examples: The town lay in ruins after years of bombing.

definitions.definition: to be in an extremely bad state:
examples: The economy was in ruins after the war.
